Forms Guide

PhilJS provides powerful form handling with reactive validation, server actions, and progressive enhancement out of the box.

Basic Form Handling

Create reactive forms using signals to track form state. PhilJS forms integrate naturally with the reactivity system:

ContactForm.tsxtsx
1import { createSignal } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3function ContactForm() {
4  const [name, setName] = createSignal('');
5  const [email, setEmail] = createSignal('');
6  const [message, setMessage] = createSignal('');
7  const [submitting, setSubmitting] = createSignal(false);
8 
9  const handleSubmit = async (e: Event) => {
10    e.preventDefault();
11    setSubmitting(true);
12 
13    try {
14      await fetch('/api/contact', {
15        method: 'POST',
16        headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' },
17        body: JSON.stringify({
18          name: name(),
19          email: email(),
20          message: message(),
21        }),
22      });
23      // Reset form
24      setName('');
25      setEmail('');
26      setMessage('');
27    } finally {
28      setSubmitting(false);
29    }
30  };
31 
32  return (
33    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit}>
34      <input
35        type="text"
36        value={name()}
37        onInput={(e) => setName(e.target.value)}
38        placeholder="Your name"
39        required
40      />
41      <input
42        type="email"
43        value={email()}
44        onInput={(e) => setEmail(e.target.value)}
45        placeholder="your@email.com"
46        required
47      />
48      <textarea
49        value={message()}
50        onInput={(e) => setMessage(e.target.value)}
51        placeholder="Your message"
52        required
53      />
54      <button type="submit" disabled={submitting()}>
55        {submitting() ? 'Sending...' : 'Send Message'}
56      </button>
57    </form>
58  );
59}

Using philjs-forms

For more complex forms, the philjs-forms package provides a declarative API with built-in validation:

SignupForm.tsxtsx
1import { createForm, required, email, minLength } from 'philjs-forms';
2 
3function SignupForm() {
4  const form = createForm({
5    fields: {
6      username: {
7        initial: '',
8        validate: [
9          required('Username is required'),
10          minLength(3, 'Username must be at least 3 characters'),
11        ],
12      },
13      email: {
14        initial: '',
15        validate: [
16          required('Email is required'),
17          email('Please enter a valid email'),
18        ],
19      },
20      password: {
21        initial: '',
22        validate: [
23          required('Password is required'),
24          minLength(8, 'Password must be at least 8 characters'),
25        ],
26      },
27    },
28    onSubmit: async (values) => {
29      await createUser(values);
30    },
31  });
32 
33  return (
34    <form use:form>
35      <div>
36        <label>Username</label>
37        <input type="text" name="username" />
38        <Show when={form.errors.username}>
39          <span class="error">{form.errors.username}</span>
40        </Show>
41      </div>
42 
43      <div>
44        <label>Email</label>
45        <input type="email" name="email" />
46        <Show when={form.errors.email}>
47          <span class="error">{form.errors.email}</span>
48        </Show>
49      </div>
50 
51      <div>
52        <label>Password</label>
53        <input type="password" name="password" />
54        <Show when={form.errors.password}>
55          <span class="error">{form.errors.password}</span>
56        </Show>
57      </div>
58 
59      <button type="submit" disabled={form.submitting || !form.valid}>
60        {form.submitting ? 'Creating account...' : 'Sign Up'}
61      </button>
62    </form>
63  );
64}

Validation

PhilJS forms support both synchronous and asynchronous validation with built-in validators and custom validation functions:

Built-in Validators

validators.tstypescript
1import {
2  required,
3  email,
4  minLength,
5  maxLength,
6  pattern,
7  min,
8  max,
9  url,
10  matches,
11} from 'philjs-forms';
12 
13const validators = {
14  // Required field
15  name: [required('Name is required')],
16 
17  // Email validation
18  email: [required(), email('Invalid email format')],
19 
20  // Length constraints
21  username: [minLength(3), maxLength(20)],
22 
23  // Regex pattern
24  phone: [pattern(/^\d{10}$/, 'Enter 10-digit phone number')],
25 
26  // Numeric range
27  age: [min(18, 'Must be 18+'), max(120)],
28 
29  // URL validation
30  website: [url('Enter a valid URL')],
31 
32  // Field matching (e.g., password confirmation)
33  confirmPassword: [matches('password', 'Passwords must match')],
34};

Custom Validation

custom-validators.tstypescript
1import { createValidator } from 'philjs-forms';
2 
3// Synchronous custom validator
4const noSpaces = createValidator(
5  (value: string) => !value.includes(' '),
6  'No spaces allowed'
7);
8 
9// Async validator (e.g., checking username availability)
10const usernameAvailable = createValidator(
11  async (value: string) => {
12    const res = await fetch(`/api/check-username?u=${value}`);
13    const { available } = await res.json();
14    return available;
15  },
16  'Username is already taken'
17);
18 
19// Validator with dynamic message
20const strongPassword = createValidator(
21  (value: string) => {
22    const hasUpper = /[A-Z]/.test(value);
23    const hasLower = /[a-z]/.test(value);
24    const hasNumber = /\d/.test(value);
25    const hasSpecial = /[!@#$%^&*]/.test(value);
26    return hasUpper && hasLower && hasNumber && hasSpecial;
27  },
28  'Password must include uppercase, lowercase, number, and special character'
29);

Server Actions

For SSR apps, use server actions to handle form submissions securely on the server:

actions/contact.tstypescript
1// actions/contact.ts
2'use server';
3 
4import { z } from 'zod';
5import { createAction } from 'philjs-forms/server';
6 
7const contactSchema = z.object({
8  name: z.string().min(1, 'Name required'),
9  email: z.string().email('Invalid email'),
10  message: z.string().min(10, 'Message too short'),
11});
12 
13export const submitContact = createAction(contactSchema, async (data) => {
14  // This runs on the server
15  await db.contacts.create({
16    data: {
17      ...data,
18      createdAt: new Date(),
19    },
20  });
21 
22  // Send notification email
23  await sendEmail({
24    to: 'admin@example.com',
25    subject: 'New Contact Form',
26    body: `From: ${data.name} <${data.email}>\n\n${data.message}`,
27  });
28 
29  return { success: true };
30});
ContactForm.tsxtsx
1// ContactForm.tsx
2import { submitContact } from './actions/contact';
3import { useAction } from 'philjs-forms';
4 
5function ContactForm() {
6  const action = useAction(submitContact);
7 
8  return (
9    <form action={action.submit}>
10      <input name="name" required />
11      <input name="email" type="email" required />
12      <textarea name="message" required />
13 
14      <Show when={action.error}>
15        <div class="error">{action.error.message}</div>
16      </Show>
17 
18      <Show when={action.result?.success}>
19        <div class="success">Message sent!</div>
20      </Show>
21 
22      <button type="submit" disabled={action.pending}>
23        {action.pending ? 'Sending...' : 'Send'}
24      </button>
25    </form>
26  );
27}
i

Progressive Enhancement

Server actions work without JavaScript enabled. The form submits normally and the page reloads with the result. When JS is available, submissions are handled via fetch for a smoother experience.

File Uploads

Handle file uploads with the FileUpload component from philjs-ui:

AvatarUpload.tsxtsx
1import { FileUpload } from 'philjs-ui';
2import { createSignal } from 'philjs-core';
3 
4function AvatarUpload() {
5  const [file, setFile] = createSignal<File | null>(null);
6  const [preview, setPreview] = createSignal<string>('');
7  const [uploading, setUploading] = createSignal(false);
8 
9  const handleSelect = (files: File[]) => {
10    const selected = files[0];
11    setFile(selected);
12 
13    // Create preview URL
14    const url = URL.createObjectURL(selected);
15    setPreview(url);
16  };
17 
18  const handleUpload = async () => {
19    const f = file();
20    if (!f) return;
21 
22    setUploading(true);
23    const formData = new FormData();
24    formData.append('avatar', f);
25 
26    try {
27      const res = await fetch('/api/upload-avatar', {
28        method: 'POST',
29        body: formData,
30      });
31      const { url } = await res.json();
32      // Update user profile with new avatar URL
33    } finally {
34      setUploading(false);
35    }
36  };
37 
38  return (
39    <div>
40      <FileUpload
41        accept="image/*"
42        maxSize={5 * 1024 * 1024} // 5MB
43        onSelect={handleSelect}
44      >
45        <Show
46          when={preview()}
47          fallback={<span>Drop image or click to select</span>}
48        >
49          <img src={preview()} alt="Preview" class="avatar-preview" />
50        </Show>
51      </FileUpload>
52 
53      <Show when={file()}>
54        <button onClick={handleUpload} disabled={uploading()}>
55          {uploading() ? 'Uploading...' : 'Upload Avatar'}
56        </button>
57      </Show>
58    </div>
59  );
60}

Dynamic Form Arrays

Create dynamic forms with add/remove functionality for array fields:

InvoiceForm.tsxtsx
1import { createSignal, For } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3interface LineItem {
4  id: number;
5  description: string;
6  quantity: number;
7  price: number;
8}
9 
10function InvoiceForm() {
11  let nextId = 1;
12  const [items, setItems] = createSignal<LineItem[]>([
13    { id: nextId++, description: '', quantity: 1, price: 0 },
14  ]);
15 
16  const addItem = () => {
17    setItems([...items(), {
18      id: nextId++,
19      description: '',
20      quantity: 1,
21      price: 0
22    }]);
23  };
24 
25  const removeItem = (id: number) => {
26    setItems(items().filter(item => item.id !== id));
27  };
28 
29  const updateItem = (id: number, field: keyof LineItem, value: any) => {
30    setItems(items().map(item =>
31      item.id === id ? { ...item, [field]: value } : item
32    ));
33  };
34 
35  const total = () => items().reduce(
36    (sum, item) => sum + item.quantity * item.price,
37    0
38  );
39 
40  return (
41    <form>
42      <table>
43        <thead>
44          <tr>
45            <th>Description</th>
46            <th>Qty</th>
47            <th>Price</th>
48            <th>Total</th>
49            <th></th>
50          </tr>
51        </thead>
52        <tbody>
53          <For each={items()}>
54            {(item) => (
55              <tr>
56                <td>
57                  <input
58                    value={item.description}
59                    onInput={(e) => updateItem(item.id, 'description', e.target.value)}
60                  />
61                </td>
62                <td>
63                  <input
64                    type="number"
65                    value={item.quantity}
66                    onInput={(e) => updateItem(item.id, 'quantity', +e.target.value)}
67                  />
68                </td>
69                <td>
70                  <input
71                    type="number"
72                    step="0.01"
73                    value={item.price}
74                    onInput={(e) => updateItem(item.id, 'price', +e.target.value)}
75                  />
76                </td>
77                <td>${(item.quantity * item.price).toFixed(2)}</td>
78                <td>
79                  <button type="button" onClick={() => removeItem(item.id)}>
80                    Remove
81                  </button>
82                </td>
83              </tr>
84            )}
85          </For>
86        </tbody>
87        <tfoot>
88          <tr>
89            <td colSpan={3}>Total</td>
90            <td>${total().toFixed(2)}</td>
91            <td></td>
92          </tr>
93        </tfoot>
94      </table>
95 
96      <button type="button" onClick={addItem}>
97        Add Line Item
98      </button>
99    </form>
100  );
101}

Form Accessibility

!

Accessibility

Always include proper labels, error announcements, and keyboard navigation in your forms for accessibility compliance.
AccessibleInput.tsxtsx
1function AccessibleInput({
2  name,
3  label,
4  error,
5  required,
6  ...props
7}: InputProps) {
8  const inputId = `input-${name}`;
9  const errorId = `error-${name}`;
10 
11  return (
12    <div class="form-group">
13      <label htmlFor={inputId}>
14        {label}
15        {required && <span aria-label="required">*</span>}
16      </label>
17 
18      <input
19        id={inputId}
20        name={name}
21        required={required}
22        aria-required={required}
23        aria-invalid={!!error}
24        aria-describedby={error ? errorId : undefined}
25        {...props}
26      />
27 
28      <Show when={error}>
29        <span id={errorId} class="error" role="alert">
30          {error}
31        </span>
32      </Show>
33    </div>
34  );
35}
